text:
So this looks neat, but I do have one question.

Sure it encrypts your .env file so if you accidentally commit it, or someone is in your computer, they are encrypted.

But.
It creates a .env.keys file. Which is the private key for it. So now if you accidentally commit THAT file, or someone is in your computer, you are still fucked, no? :smile: what am i missing

elements.text:
So this looks neat, but I do have one question.

Sure it encrypts your .env file so if you accidentally commit it, or someone is in your computer, they are encrypted.

But.
It creates a .env.keys file. Which is the private key for it. So now if you accidentally commit THAT file, or someone is in your computer, you are still fucked, no?
what am i missing

text: Every env encryption library seems to just shift the responsibility from the .env file to... another file. i must be missing smth

elements.text: Every env encryption library seems to just shift the responsibility from the .env file to... another file. i must be missing smth

text:
say i need a .env on an EC2 for my service. i want to encrypt it, so if the box is compromised, im safe (why else would i encrypt it?). but i need either:
• another file next to it, that can decrypt it
• api keys to Hashicorp Vault/ Google /AWS Secrets manager in a file to fetch secrets

elements.text: say i need a .env on an EC2 for my service. i want to encrypt it, so if the box is compromised, im safe (why else would i encrypt it?). but i need either:
another file next to it, that can decrypt it
api keys to Hashicorp Vault/ Google /AWS Secrets manager in a file to fetch secrets

text:
I usually use this: <https://github.com/AGWA/git-crypt>

It has a state stored somewhere in the $HOME/.idontknow and uses that for encrypt/decrypt

attachments.fallback: GitHub: GitHub - AGWA/git-crypt: Transparent file encryption in git
attachments.text: Transparent file encryption in git. Contribute to AGWA/git-crypt development by creating an account on GitHub.
attachments.title: GitHub - AGWA/git-crypt: Transparent file encryption in git

text:
I fixed everything so the canton billing admin is stable: <https://canton-billing-admin-devnet-903844854cba.herokuapp.com/create-client>
I think it is make sense to create CBTC Minter and CBTC Holder in two separate actions. So minimize the chance of failure.
There is a button to set metadata, which is filled with default values just in case we want to modify them from the UI and not sending the default.

Question:
• What should be the default values for that?
• Can I deploy this to production? I do not worry about the authentication, because once it is ready and stable I start to work on the auth so there will be only one day before I make that happen. I think it is impossible that anyone finds it within a day.

There is a button to set metadata, which is filled with default values just in case we want to modify them from the UI and not sending the default.

Question:
What should be the default values for that?

Can I deploy this to production? I do not worry about the authentication, because once it is ready and stable I start to work on the auth so there will be only one day before I make that happen. I think it is impossible that anyone finds it within a day.

text:
What is the workflow right now? I just want to deploy the Go app as well first to devnet just to see how it works with the postgres.
Also should I keep in mind anything while I deploy the canton background job? I ask it because <@U05FU0HPZ9T> deployed it.

elements.text:
What is the workflow right now? I just want to deploy the Go app as well first to devnet just to see how it works with the postgres.
Also should I keep in mind anything while I deploy the canton background job? I ask it because
deployed it.

text:
Plans:
1. Deploy the admin tool to "prod".
2. Check whether the canton billing app works properly with the postgres database and deploy the devnet. If it works properly I can deploy a prod version as well.
3. I work on the authentication and release at least a minimal version where the user can login with keycloak and it sends the JWT to the backend. The backend parse the JWT token and checks whether it is "valid" (it can't check properly, but at minimum it will be enough).
4. I add party listing to the admin tool.

elements.text: Plans:
Deploy the admin tool to "prod".
Check whether the canton billing app works properly with the postgres database and deploy the devnet. If it works properly I can deploy a prod version as well.

I work on the authentication and release at least a minimal version where the user can login with keycloak and it sends the JWT to the backend. The backend parse the JWT token and checks whether it is "valid" (it can't check properly, but at minimum it will be enough).
I add party listing to the admin tool.

text:
I think the parties CBTC Minter and CBTC Holder are two separate entities. So create one at the time is much cleaner. The BD team member enter a client ID and visually validate that the particular party has been created. If it fails it can start over. Sometimes it fails (at least on devnet) because of unknown reason. It is pretty rare that it fails, but happened to me. After validated that the party have been created can click on the add another client and paste the client ID.
The reason not just because it fails, but there would be so much information on the UI like two separate progress flow and two separate result flow. I think based on UX (I'm not a UX designer :D) it is easier to doing only one thing on a page at the time. Since the UI is so simple It is like a few extra click to the another.

elements.text:
I think the parties CBTC Minter and CBTC Holder are two separate entities. So create one at the time is much cleaner. The BD team member enter a client ID and visually validate that the particular party has been created. If it fails it can start over. Sometimes it fails (at least on devnet) because of unknown reason. It is pretty rare that it fails, but happened to me. After validated that the party have been created can click on the add another client and paste the client ID.
The reason not just because it fails, but there would be so much information on the UI like two separate progress flow and two separate result flow. I think based on UX (I'm not a UX designer :D) it is easier to doing only one thing on a page at the time. Since the UI is so simple It is like a few extra click to the another.

text:
> One note but I’m sure your aware, that we have to migrate existing parties to the db
The Go background job is backward compatible, reads from the ENV var and from the database, so it is not urgent to add the existing parties to the database.

elements.text: One note but I’m sure your aware, that we have to migrate existing parties to the db
The Go background job is backward compatible, reads from the ENV var and from the database, so it is not urgent to add the existing parties to the database.

text:
Hmmm I disagree, as the BD team said they want both every single time. So they will do both in each case, so now it’s double the clicks and waits, instead of us handling that. And the progress bar is meant to represent all of them, since the steps are capable for multiparty anyway.  
Also we talked about having batch creations as well, where they can paste in a list of 5-10, and it creates both for all. So now that will be even harder. 

But yes it sometimes fails, especially the last step with a 429, but it actually succeeds, just the wallet_api is lying with its error code :D 

Anyway we can ship it as is! And get some costumer feedback quick, even with a devnet deployment

elements.text: Hmmm I disagree, as the BD team said they want both every single time. So they will do both in each case, so now
it’s

double the clicks and waits, instead of us handling that. And the progress bar is meant to represent all of them, since the steps are capable for multiparty anyway.  
Also we talked about having batch creations as well, where they can paste in a list of 5-10, and it creates both for all. So now that will be even harder. 

But yes it sometimes fails, especially the last step with a 429, but it actually succeeds, just the wallet_api is lying with its error code :D 

Anyway we can ship it as is! And get some costumer feedback quick, even with a devnet deployment
